alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Overnight through Thursday afternoon. The heaviest snow is expected Thursday morning.

Additional information:
Light snow over the area this evening is expected to intensify overnight, with bursts of heavy snow possible at times.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall Thursday night into Friday morning.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 15 cm, with local amounts near 25 cm possible.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 4 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Thursday evening to Friday morning.

Additional information:
An Alberta clipper will bring snow, heavy at times, to northwestern Ontario. The highest snowfall amounts are likely over areas of higher terrain, especially near Thunder Bay.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

affected_areas.area_description: Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul
Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Reduced visibility in heavy snow, especially along Highway 17 and Highway 101 between Wawa and Lake Superior Provincial Park.

When:
This morning.

Additional information:
The heavy snow is expected to ease to periods of light snow later this morning.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Reduced visibility at times in heavy snow.

When:
This morning.

Additional information:
Poor visibility in bands of heavy snow moving through the area may impact the morning commute, especially in urban areas. Snowfall accumulations of 2 to 5 cm are expected, though some melting is likely on paved surfaces.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

affected_areas.area_description: Belleville - Quinte West - Eastern Northumberland County
Peterborough City - Lakefield - Southern Peterborough County
Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County
Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

alerts.headline: weather advisory ended
alerts.description:
Conditions have improved.

###

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Reduced visibility at times in heavy snow.
Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm.

When:
Later this morning through this afternoon.

Additional information:
Light snow is forecast to intensify later this morning as bands of heavy snow move into the area. Visibility will be significantly reduced at times under these snow bands. The snow is expected to taper to flurries by this evening.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

affected_areas.area_description: Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul
Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: extreme cold warning in effect
alerts.description:
A period of very cold wind chills is expected.

Wind chill values near minus 45 are expected overnight into Friday morning. 

Temperatures are expected to moderate on Friday and remain just above extreme cold conditions Friday night.

###

Extreme cold puts everyone at risk.

Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction:
Cover up. Frostbite can develop within minutes on exposed skin, especially with wind chill.

If it’s too cold for you to stay outside, it’s too cold for your pet to stay outside.
